items.title: 80 lb transformation
items.context: Before and after fitness photo showing major weight loss.
items.content: "Ryan if you use Zax Sauce as salad dressing, you will get fat again." This #transformation goes entirely to my #friends who have lead by example and kept me honest through this process. Last week I finally eclipsed the 80 lb mark. Eighty pounds ago I was unhealthy, depressed and relentlessly tired/stressed. While the journey isn't over, this was one moment I planned on letting gratitude (and yeah definitely some #vanity) get the best of me. In the end there are infinitely more valuable ways to invest in your person (intelligence, personality, experience, relationships, adventure, etc) but there's also nothing better than feeling healthy and being comfortable in your own skin. Happy #transformationtuesday yall, and thank you. #pride #tuesday #fatboy #fattuesdayboy #fitfam #fit #fitness #journey #gym #snapfitness #model #muscle #shirtless #salad #zaxsauce #zaxbys #chickenfingers #tacos #bbq #dammitnowimhungry #notagain
items.user_prompt: Write an Instagram caption. Post title: 80 lb transformation Context: Before and after fitness photo showing major weight loss. Topics: fitness, health, reflection Tone: grateful, vulnerable, proud

items.title: The Grid LED project
items.context: Electronics and LEDs on the bed, timed to music.
items.content:
(Swipe left for video) The Grid progressed a lot during the start of #quarantine: it's a Raspberry Pi powered 1800 LED musically timed light show written in C/C++ (for our basement). Then... work/real life piled on. If there any #devs or enthusiasts out there who want to help restart/finish it, hit me up. Was working on Mk 3. *volume level warning* üò¨

items.title: Two years offline, plus Dakota
items.context: Slideshow of Ryan and Dakota with a long reflective caption.
items.content:
Two years ago, had you told me I was going to abandon my insta (and the other socials) for some reason, I would have laughed at your nonsense and found you some water to sober up‚Ä¶ but now that it's happened, I find myself attempting to stitch words together that might adequately describe the 2+ years that just slipped by.

As you probably know, at the end of 2021 someone special began appearing in my stories. It didn't take long to realize @dr.djr_ wasn't the ‚Äúchange your relationship status‚Äù kind of special, as much as the ‚Äúchange your outlook on life‚Äù kind of special. In the whirlwind since, we've traveled, explored, adventured and have grown together more than I'd ever dreamed possible‚Ä¶ a journey that representing in just ten photos proved exceptionally hard.

Scrolling through again, every image feels like more than just a snapshot of a place; but like chapters of a story. And more than anything, it's a story that's taught me that the most precious moments are those shared with someone who understands not just who you are, but who you have the potential to be. Someone who sees beauty in your flaws and strength in your vulnerabilities. Someone who makes every day an adventure, whether we're crossing time zones or just crossing the street.

I'm finally mashing the share button now to correct a glaring omission to this feed, and dispense gratitude for the adventures I've had with the people (and particular person) who've made them unforgettable. To all of us who've been long connected, know that the greatest stories are sometimes those we live offline, becoming our most authentic selves, in the company of those who we love the most. And while I weigh the prospect of posting more on the gram and catching up on these last formative years, I can't argue against the idea of taking a break, stepping back, and discovering/cherishing the things that truly bring us joy.

To quote one of my favorite authors: It's been a journey of discovery, love, and the kind of growth that only comes when you're willing to lose sight of the shore.

Grateful for every single friend who's been a part of my/our journey‚Ä¶ in any capacity. Cheers to the adventures that await.

<3 #bf
items.user_prompt: Write an Instagram caption. Post title: Two years offline, plus Dakota Context: Slideshow of Ryan and Dakota with a long reflective caption. Topics: relationships, reflection, social media Tone: introspective, warm, grateful

items.title: Gen 6 taking shape
items.context: Work prototype Gen 6 in the hangar.
items.content:
Five years in‚Ä¶

It's hard to describe what it feels like to watch something you've only been able to imagine take shape in metal and composite. An idea that existed in drawing, renderings, requirements, models and emails - born from hundreds of hands and minds, from late nights and early mornings, from the kind of stubborn optimism that only aviation seems to inspire.

But now it's in our hangar, making final preparations for first flight. I am beyond blessed for the opportunity to be part of this team of aviators and nerds who work on the bleeding edge of aerospace.

Anyway ‚Ä¶ more to come. Especially when this thing takes to the skies in the coming weeks! üöÄ

#Wisk #eVTOL #Gen6 #FutureOfFlight #BuiltNotRendered #HardWorkWorks
items.user_prompt: Write an Instagram caption. Post title: Gen 6 taking shape Context: Work prototype Gen 6 in the hangar. Topics: aerospace, work, eVTOL Tone: proud, awed
